StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Transcriptome-wide association study to identify susceptibility genes for colorectal cancer

Person.Organization: ALBERT EINSTEIN COLLEGE OF MEDICINEVANDERBILT UNIVERSITY MEDICAL CENTERALBERT EINSTEIN COLLEGE OF MEDICINEVANDERBILT UNIVERSITY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The genotype data from 400 study participants of East Asian descent, along with RNA-seq (n=300) and small RNA-seq data (n=400) generated in their breast tissue samples, were supported by NIH grant R37CA227130.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, PUB, COL)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-PUB-COL
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).
The letter of collaboration for this study is the "Vanderbilt University Medical Center Collaborator Agreement Governing Access to, and Use and Disclosure of, Data from the 'Transcriptome-wide association study to identify susceptibility genes for colorectal cancer' Maintained in the NIH dbGaP Database" form from the Vanderbilt University Medical Center (VUMC). A blank copy can be found at the end of the dataset's Data Use Certification Agreement (see dbGaP study page). Requestor must provide this signed form documenting VUMC approval. Approval can be obtained by contacting Principal Investigator Dr. Xingyi Guo, (xingyi.guo@vumc.org).
